posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: So, my team has a wrist that we need to tune with PID and feedforward loops. I know the Sysid tool could be used for this but I was also told the rev hardware client can also be useful for PID tuning. Could someone explain to me how that works or link to documentation? I can’t seem to find it. Thanks!

posts.name: Kyle Reeve
posts.cooked: Read the manual . You can use the Telemetry tab to plot your position as you’re tuning

link_counts.title: Navigating the Client - SPARK MAX - REV Hardware Client

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: and as long as the computer running the rev hardware client is connected to the robot, you can run the spark max without executing code?

posts.name: Kyle Reeve
posts.cooked:
Correct.

Keep in mind, you have to have power from a robot battery connected to the motor to run it, you can’t run it when you’re just powering the SPARK Max via USB-C.

Also, I’m pretty sure you can’t run it if CAN is connected to the Roborio, as the Roborio will send a “disable” signal by default.

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: so you have to disconnect the CAN loop and connect the spark max to the computer via usb while the robot is on?

posts.name: system
